content.description: Longest route on the wall. Also at the corner so feels the most exposed.
content.protection: Two bolt top rope anchor hidden slightly over the edge (regular hangers - not cold shuts)
content.location: Sixth and last route on the wall.

content.description: Fifth route on the wall. A bit steeper than the 5.5 to the left.
content.protection: Cold shuts on top. No bolts for sport.

content.description: Fourth set of anchors of six. One of the most fun routes on the cliff.
content.protection: Cold shuts on top. No bolts for sport.
content.location: Fourth set of anchors, basically in the center of the rock face.

content.description: Slab start to a brief vertical section and finish up on varied alligator skin terrain.
content.location: The middle of the face just to the right of the large blocky flake. Directly below the 3rd pair (center pair) of cold-shut anchors

content.description: Easy slab start, then follow the blocky flake to the left and up some alligator skin to the top.
content.location: The obvious blocky flake on the left side of the face. Directly below the 2nd pair of cold-shut anchors from the left

content.description: Follows the black water stain past a large ledge a little over half way to the top.
content.location: The obvious black water stain on the left side of the face. Directly below the leftmost of five pairs of cold-shut anchors.

content.description:
The Practice Cliff is a top-rope area popular with beginning climbers, recreational rappellers, and the local guide services.  It's a place to introduce a beginner to climbing as the lines here fall in the 5.3-5.6 range at most. 

  It is also directly below the Windy Point Overlook, so watch out for rocks and litter thrown by tourists above.  I strongly recommend a rope-bag or tarp, as broken glass at the base of this crag is the norm.
